newsitem.title: SPAIN: Prison worker shot, hurt in Spain's Basque region.
newsitem.headline: Prison worker shot, hurt in Spain's Basque region.

text.p: A prison worker was shot and wounded by two unidentified gunmen in Spain's Basque region on Wednesday, emergency services officials said.
Another prison worker was killed last month in an attack blamed on ETA (Basque Homeland and Freedom) separatist rebels.
The wounded man, a worker at the Martutene prison in San Sebastian, was taken to hospital where officials said he had wounds to the face and neck but was out of danger.
Basque police said the attackers fled on a motorcycle.

The attack came on the same day that ETA's political wing, Herri Batasuna, paid bail to release its 22 leaders, whose jailing two months ago on charges of association with armed groups coincided with an escalation in separatist violence.
ETA has killed some 800 people since starting a violent campaign for Basque independence in 1968.
